page.title: 02CASTLE BYTHAM'S NEW BRIDGE
page.content: The small river that flows through Castle Bytham needed some work doing to it.Due to land drainage near the A1 trunk road flooding in the village became an increasing problem.Also the old bridge which crossed it at St.Martin's was very dilapidated. Eventually heavy farm traffic cracked it.The name of the old bridge was Irishman's Bridge - a very rustic affair constructed from oil cans and concrete. In Nov. 1984 the Anglian Water Board began work on widening the river and constructing a wider and sturdier bridge.After six months the work was completed,much to the relief of the residents of St.Martin's and nearby cottages.
